newsitem.title: USA: FOB Gulf Grain - Soybean, corn basis down.
newsitem.headline: FOB Gulf Grain - Soybean, corn basis down.

text.p: U.S. FOB Gulf soybean and corn values moved lower, with soybeans reacting to the narrowing of CBOT August's premium to November, traders said.
Weak export demand weighed on corn values. However, Taiwan was scheduled to tender overnight for 54,000 tonnes of U.S. corn for August-September shipment.
Winter wheat values were mostly unchanged. Soft red winter wheat harvest resumed Wednesday, which should increase grain movement into export channels, dealers said.
CORN (No. 3 yellow, FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu) -
LH July unq nc +25.5 + U nc
Note: N=CBOT July, U=CBOT Sept, nc=no comparison.
SOYBEANS (No. 2 yellow, FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu)
LH July unq nc +62 + Q nc
September unq nc unq + X nc
FH Oct unq nc +72 + X nc
LH Oct unq nc +50 + X up 1
Note: Q=CBOT August, X=CBOT November, nc=no comparison
SRW WHEAT (FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu) -
HRW WHEAT (FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis KCBT, cts/bu) -
